title: This Day in History: Sept. 13
text:
On this day, Sept. 13 ...

1996: Tupac Shakur dies at a Las Vegas hospital six days after he was wounded in a drive-by shooting.

Also on this day:

1943: Chiang Kai-Shek becomes president of China.

Chiang Kai-Shek becomes president of China. 1948: Republican Margaret Chase Smith of Maine is elected to the U.S. Senate, becoming the first woman to serve in both chambers of Congress.

Republican Margaret Chase Smith of Maine is elected to the U.S. Senate, becoming the first woman to serve in both chambers of Congress. 1962: Mississippi Gov. Ross Barnett rejects the U.S. Supreme Court's order for the University of Mississippi to admit James Meredith, a black student, declaring in a televised address, "We will not drink from the cup of genocide."

Mississippi Gov. Ross Barnett rejects the U.S. Supreme Court's order for the University of Mississippi to admit James Meredith, a black student, declaring in a televised address, "We will not drink from the cup of genocide." 1971: A four-day inmates' rebellion at the Attica Correctional Facility in western New York ends as police and guards storm the prison; the ordeal and final assault claims the lives of 32 inmates and 11 hostages.
